input_text:
Job Title: Traveling Lead Fire Alarm Technician

Location: Richardson, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

As a Fire Alarm Installation and Repair Technician at Honeywell, you will support the on-site installation, servicing, and repair processes of complex fire alarm equipment and systems. You will work under direct supervision and may also work without supervision, following detailed work instructions and escalating any discrepancies in customer requirements, blueprints, or work instructions. Your role will involve identifying, escalating, and exploring opportunities to improve installation or repair procedures, as well as providing customer support and training on proper usage for complex systems.

You can be based out of any location in the United States but must be willing to travel 75% of the time across the US based or US territory on project location for 2 - 3 weeks at a time. 

The salary for this position is ($64,000 - 95,000). The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors.

Key Responsibilities

Inspect fire alarm equipment and systems for quality.Install or repair fire alarm equipment and systems according to work ordersEscalate any issues or discrepancies in customer requirements.Provide customer support and training on proper usage of complex systems.

U.s. Person Requirements

Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a U.S. Person, which is defined as, a U.S. citizen, a U.S. permanent resident, or have protected status in the U.S. under asylum or refugee status.

YOU MUST HAVE

High School Diploma or equivalentFive years of experience in fire alarm installationNICET Level II Certification, with ability to acquire Level III within 90 days of hire.Ability to pass requirements for government background.

WE VALUE

Previous industry experience, specifically with Notifier Fire Alarm SystemsPrevious technical/installation experiencePrevious customer service experienceGood written and oral communication skillsAbility to follow instructions and identify mistakesBachelor's degree or technical/professional certificateGood presentation skills

Additional Information

JOB ID: HRD227441Category: Customer ExperienceLocation: 830 E Arapaho Rd,Richardson,Texas,75081,United StatesNonexempt

Business Services

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
